page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO KEMPSTON
page.content: Kempston was said to be the{"the {largest village in England."}It began by the River Great Ouse and one of the oldest landmarks is the{mill}close by the{manor house.}Kempston has below average unemployment and a newly built {Industrial Estate}will provide more jobs in the area.The centre of Kempston is 250m south of the Manor. Its original name was{Camestone,}a name still used for a local school. Kempston is situated S.W. of Bedford which has a rail connection with London and Sheffield. It is a 20min. drive away from the M1 Motorway.The {population is 16,000.}There is one large park with a centre called the Addison Park/Centre.Next to that is the Library and some smaller shops.Kempston has a larger shopping area called{The Saxon Centre.
